main event: The sighting occurred on May 11, 1958, 6 miles west of Chillicothe, Mo. The observation lasted for approximately 1 minute and the object was described as an oblong, brownish-colored object resembling a collapsed balloon with particles hanging from the main body. The pilot passed the object in view for the duration of the sighting.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a collapsed balloon with radiosonde equipment.
The sighting was made by a reliable military pilot, 2/Lt Jerry J. Trout of the 124th FIS.
There were multiple reports of balloons released by the service and national weather being mistaken for UFOs.
No discernible text was found in the photograph provided in the report.
The object appeared stationary, and the pilot passed by it at an altitude of approximately 34,200 feet.
sighted object: oblong, brownish-colored object resembling a collapsed balloon with particles hanging from the main body
